_header: The wise man in his book hath this saying
Note: Each stanza a Latin proverb, attributed to a prophet, poet, or saint, followed by French translation and comment, and English translation of French.
Versification: — four-line, eight-line, two-line — aabb, aabbccdd, aa
_description: Proverbs of old Philosophers, in Latin, French, and English — the English text usually in quatrains (aabb)

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Þe wyse mon in his bok haþ þis seyingÞat
                    þe biginnyng of good liuyng…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And god þat made alle þingȝif vs alle good
                    endyngA. M. E. N. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Note: Interspersed with French and Latin verse; in couplets.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Minor Poems of the Vernon Manuscript, Part 2.
EETS
         o.s. 117 (1901; repr. 1973): 2.522-53.

BLHar4733.First Lines: The wyse man in his boke hat thys seyngthat the begynnyng of good lyvyngOuer all thyng ys god to drede…
BLHar4733.Last Lines: …And god that made all thyngeȝeve vs all good endyng
BLHar4733.Note: English text only. Names of philosopher above each quatrain, the first “Dauid.”
BLHar4733.Attributed Title: Vicarium de Maldone et cetera (rubric, f. 30)

BLAdd22283.First Lines:
Þe wise mon in his bok haþ þis seingÞat þe
                    biginnynge of gode… lyuyng
BLAdd22283.Last Lines:
…He þat ȝiftes withouten decertHis freodam he
                    sulleþ & looseþ apert…
BLAdd22283.Note: Two folios missing between ff. 118v and 119.
BLAdd22283.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library MS Add. 22283 (‘Simeon’).
         2014; http://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Add_MS_22283.
